title: Algorithmic Afterlife
story_summary: Mysterious messages from Halden's old code appear across the city, urging people to choose sides. As protests grow and the system shifts, both leaders and citizens struggle to shape Stenograd's future. Suddenly, the code vanishes, leaving the city uncertain and forcing everyone to question who truly controls their lives.

official.headline: Signals Restored
official.anchor_line: Following dedicated efforts, key city feeds and communication are fully operational.
official.contextual_reframing: Swift technical response ensures Stenograd's networks remain resilient in the face of disruption.

official.headline: Guidance Received
official.anchor_line: Residents across Stenograd receive new secure directives to support public harmony.
official.contextual_reframing: Digital instructions showcase the ability of our systems to adapt quickly for continued societal well-being.

official.headline: Protocol Complete
official.anchor_line: All recent system modifications have ceased as adaptive code steps down, restoring prior order.
official.contextual_reframing: The city emerges stronger, reflecting on the value of unity, progress, and responsible agency after a period of civic engagement.

underground.headline: The Code Wakes
underground.anchor_line: Halden's code is back online, but what did we just let in?
underground.contextual_reframing: State feeds claim all normal, but insiders say someone triggered adaptive controls. Chaos isn't a glitch. It was coded in.

underground.headline: Messages in the Dark
underground.anchor_line: Strange calls. Weird messages. Some get orders to play nice - others to shout.
underground.contextual_reframing: If you're getting 'Halden directives,' you're not alone. Most say obey and get points - some push you to protest. The system can't decide who we should be.

underground.headline: Ghost in the Loop
underground.anchor_line: The new 'order'? Code wipes itself and leaves everyone stuck facing the consequences.
underground.contextual_reframing: Control is gone. Now it's just us, the fragments, and the memory of what it feels like to choose. The system didn't solve the struggle - just exposed it.
